Articles.Content:
OMG. WE HAVE TO DO THIS. This is the best idea i've ever gotten. Imagine you were placing a ladder like it was a strut. That would be AWSOME.

Or better yet, add procedural ladders. Pick a point A and a point B, and the ladder's there. That's awsome.

Edited June 21, 2014 by vexx32
Formatting fix.
Might want to fix a slight typo in the title, but this is a great idea!
Would do wonders for part count. I prefer using fixed ladders rather than retractable ones wherever possible, but the part count goes nuts adding three rungs at a time.
While we're at it, a stock version of this has been needed for some time.

While we're at it, a stock version of this has been needed for some time.

*GASP* Must... have. Must... have... in... stock.

Remember, the procedural ladders thing?

If we had that, i would spazzout for hours.

I'm afraid it's not as simple as it looks. All current struts work by stretching the middle part instead of correctly adding segments (you can see it very clearly on a fuel pipe where arrows are stretched).

But yes, if possible: I'd love to see that. It'd really help simplifying the designs.
I love both the ideas. The strut ladder AND that little bendy ladder mod being added or developed. Great idea!
OMG why hasn't this been suggested before.
